member.summary: The supported (loaded) endpoints. Will be filled out by the infrastructure at load time (i.e., a simple get; set; implementation is fine).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisServiceManagementExtension.Parameters

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisServiceManagementExtension.Logger
member.summary: Gets an instance of the logger. This will be set prior to any functions being called (although it will not be initialized in the constructor; for any initialization time logic, use OnLoad) when running in ACIS context. For test purposes, your test code can set it to an instance of AcisSMEConsoleLogger (or other logger implementation if desired). In other words, your client library itself should not set this, only external sources (your test code, our ACIS code).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisServiceManagementExtension.Configuration
member.summary: Gets the configuration of the extension. Will be set by ACIS prior to any functions being called (i.e., a simple get; set implementation is fine).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisServiceManagementExtension.ExtensionEnvironment
member.summary: Gets the extension environment. Will bet set by ACIS prior to any functions being called. i.e., a simple get; set; implementation is fine. Do not do an actual implementation beyond that.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisServiceManagementExtension.Certificates

member.summary: AcisSMEOperation provides a basic level of default functionality for operations to make it easier for client libraries. See also the various implementers for further simplifying implementations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisSMEOperation.OperationKey
member.summary: Short, simplified name for operation. Used to identify the operation, and is exposed in command-line interfaces. No non-alphanumeric characters permitted (no spaces, etc.)

member.summary: Gets the operation name that is displayed to the user in the UI.

member.summary: Gets the help text for the operation which will be displayed in the Actions portal. This supports markdown (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown for more information).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisSMEOperation.OperationGroup
member.summary: Gets the operation group this operation is part of. Can return something like new ExampleOperationGroup();

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisSMEOperation.ClaimsRequired
member.summary: Gets a list of claims required for the operation; any one of the claims specified is sufficient permission for the operation. Operation will be executed directly without additional approval from a sovereign cloud operator if one of those claims is present.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisSMEOperation.PrivilegeLevel
member.summary:
Gets the privilege level for the operation, which determines whether it can be run by the user, or whether it requires approval or is for national cloud operators only.
This property is ignored when scoped claims are defined, as the privilege level is inferred from the claim. For Delegated JIT Claims it will default to Standard access, but can be overridden for higher privilege levels.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisSMEOperation.ExecutionMethod
member.summary:
The MethodInfo of the function to execute. The function in question must have the same number of parameters as are returned by this.Parameters, with the exception of "known" ACIS build parameters: parameters of type IAcisSMEOperationProgressUpdater, IAcisSMEEndpoint, IAcisServiceManagementExtension, and OperationExecutionContext will all be filled out by the appropriate value without a corresponding Parameter value.
The function must return an IAcisSMEOperationResponse.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisSMEOperationGroup.DisallowedEndpoints
member.summary:
Allows the disabling of operations on specific endpoint types. May be used to have operations that are specific to a type of endpoint. The string value should equal the identifier of the endpoint in the config file.
By default, all operation groups apply to all endpoint types. Override this value to change that.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisSMEParameter.IsParameterValid(System.String,System.String,System.Object@,System.String@)
member.summary: Only called if "Custom" validation type is provided. The validationArgs may be equivalent to the ValidationArgs of this class, but ParameterRefs can override it, so the validationArgs that are passed in should be used instead of the instance member. Use correctedValue if there's a specific return type that you want to use. Leave null (i.e., don't modify the value) if there's no specific value. Use errorMessage if there's an error message you want to output. This value will only be used if IsParameterValid returns false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.IAcisServiceManagementExtension.Logger
member.summary:
Gets an instance of the logger. This will be set prior to any functions being called (although it will not be initialized in the constructor; for any initialization time logic, use OnLoad) when running in ACIS context. For test purposes, your test code can set it to an instance of AcisSMEConsoleLogger (or other logger implementation if desired).
In other words, your client library itself should not set this, only external sources (your test code, our ACIS code).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.IAcisSMEOperation.ExecutionMethod
member.summary:
The MethodInfo of the function to execute. The function in question must have the same number of parameters as are returned by this.Parameters, with the exception of "known" ACIS build parameters: parameters of type IAcisSMEOperationProgressUpdater, IAcisSMEEndpoint, IAcisServiceManagementExtension, and OperationExecutionContext will all be filled out by the appropriate value without a corresponding Parameter value.
The function must return an IAcisSMEOperationResponse.

member.summary: Implemented by SME operations to specify if the operation is idempotent. Idempotent operations should be safe for multiple retries. member.summary: Only called if "Custom" validation type is provided. The validationArgs may be equivalent to the ValidationArgs of this class, but ParameterRefs can override it, so the validationArgs that are passed in should be used instead of the instance member. Use correctedValue if there's a specific return type that you want to use. Leave null (i.e., don't modify the value) if there's no specific value. Use errorMessage if there's an error message you want to output. This value will only be used if IsParameterValid returns false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.IAcisSMEUser.GetDelegatedToken(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Security.Authentication.ServerAuthenticationMetadata,Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.IDstsNamespaceExpansions)
member.summary: Get Delegated Token

Gets the delegated token and the server certificates associated with it. The server certs are used for server authentication. If dsts returns(to the client) server certificates along with security token, then client before handing over token to server, validates the server identity certificate against those certificates. If no certs are returned as part of security token response then library will fall back on PKI validation of server certificate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.IAcisRuntimeManagerProxy
member.summary: Collection of functionality provided by the Worker role to be used by the extension host.

We don't want to add this interface to the NetStandard folder since we don't want to expose this to customers. We should never expose our RuntimeManagerProxy to customers but instead make calls to it behind the scenes in contract implementations. The reason we add these extension methods used for NetStandard user context here, is cause the NetFramework folder won't compile in the NetStandard SMEContracts and we would still have this available in the Worker RuntimeMAnager implementation because in AcisCommonContracts we include this file so that it is available to implement in the NetFx AcisRuntimeManagerProxy implementation.
In addition, we also don't want to introduce a breaking change to the existing IAcisRTMProxy which has been exposed to customers over years. Instead this extension interface serves the purpose to add more functionality which we will handle on the worker side.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.AcisSMEDynamicParam.IsCachingAllowed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether caching is allowed. By default, this is true, meaning for any given combination of user/endpoint, the value will be cached some time. If this is overridden to false then every single pageload of an operation using this will result in that operation's dynamic params being re-calculated. Try to avoid setting this to false unless absolutely necessary, as doing this may slow down pageloads of your operations.

member.summary: Only called if "Custom" validation type is provided. The validationArgs may be equivalent to the ValidationArgs of this class, but ParameterRefs can override it, so the validationArgs that are passed in should be used instead of the instance member. Use correctedValue if there's a specific return type that you want to use. Leave null (i.e., don't modify the value) if there's no specific value. Use errorMessage if there's an error message you want to output. This value will only be used if IsParameterValid returns false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.Contracts.ExtensionHostResourceUsageStats
member.summary: This class is present in AcisCommonContracts and not in AcisSMEContracts for avoiding to expose it to customers in the .Net Core contracts. .NetCore methods for RuntimePing use this class from AcisCommonContracts instead. However, during compilation for .Net Fx though, we need this class in the AcisSMEContracts as the IRTMProxy and RuntimePing are always available since legacy times for customers to use. To make the behavior same as .Net Core, we need to make a significant change - remove IRTMProxy from the .Net SME contracts.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.SME.UI.CSVDisplayHelper
member.summary: The CSV display helper is used to generate CSV output for the textbox if desired. It allows the specification of column headers and takes in a series of rows. Return it.ToString() in order to get the string output at the end.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.SME.UI.CSVDisplayHelper.SetHeaderColumns(System.String[])
member.summary: Sets the header columns (null to not display any).

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.SME.UI.CSVDisplayHelper.AddRow(System.Object[])
member.summary: Adds the row. For objects that are not strings, their .ToString() function will be called. Note that mismatch in count between headers/values is allowed - depending upon which way the mismatch is, either the cells at the end of the row will be empty of values, or some columns will be unnamed. Mid-row nulls are allowed (though they need to be explicitly specified that way, or else values to the right will be shifted to the left accordingly)

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Wapd.Acis.SME.UI.CSVDisplayHelper.GenerateFromDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Automatically fills out the headers/rows based off the specified datatable. Using this will wipe out any data produced from previous calls to SetHeaderColumns/AddRow After using this, make use of .ToString() to get the result string.
